00014 #ifndef ULIB_UXMLELEMENT_H
00015 #define ULIB_UXMLELEMENT_H 1
00016 
00017 #include <ulib/container/vector.h>
00018 #include <ulib/xml/expat/attribute.h>
00019 
00020 class U_EXPORT UXMLElement {
00021 public:
00022 
00023         // Check for memory error
00024         U_MEMORY_TEST
00025 
00026         // Allocator e Deallocator
00027         U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR
00028         U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR
00029 
00030         // Costruttori
00031 
00032         UXMLElement()
00033                 {
00034                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UXMLElement, "", 0)
00035                 }
00036 
00037         UXMLElement(const UString& s, const UString& a, const UString& n) : str(s), accessorName(a), namespaceName(n)
00038                 {
00039                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UXMLElement, "%.*S,%.*S,%.*S", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(s),
00040                                                                                                                                                                          U_STRING_TO_TRACE(a), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(n))
00041                 }
00042 
00043         ~UXMLElement()
00044                 {
00045                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UXMLElement)
00046                 }
00047 
00048         // SERVICES
00049 
00050         UString& getStr()           { return str; }
00051         UString& getValue()         { return value; }         // reference to the internal value of the element
00052         UString& getAccessorName()  { return accessorName; }  // reference to the internal accessor name
00053                                                                                                                                                         // (string used to access the element)
00054         UString& getNamespaceName() { return namespaceName; } // reference to the internal namespace name
00055 
00056         // Adds an attribute to the element
00057 
00058         void addAttribute(UXMLAttribute* attribute)
00059                 {
00060                 U_TRACE(0, "UXMLElement::addAttribute(%p)", attribute)
00061 
00062                 attributeContainer.push_back(attribute);
00063                 }
00064 
00065         // Tells the caller how many attributes this element contains
00066 
00067         uint32_t numAttributes() const { return attributeContainer.size(); }
00068 
00069         // Returns the UXMLAttribute at a specific index
00070 
00071         UXMLAttribute* attributeAt(uint32_t index) const { return attributeContainer[index]; }
00072 
00073         // Given an attribute name, this finds the named attribute.
00074         // If you are looking for a fully qualified attribute (namespace plus base name),
00075         // just pass it in. I'll find the colon (':')
00076 
00077         UXMLAttribute* getAttribute(const UString& attributeName);
00078 
00079         static void splitNamespaceAndName(const UString& str, UString& namespaceName, UString& accessorName);
00080 
00081         // STREAM
00082 
00083         friend U_EXPORT ostream& operator<<(ostream& os, const UXMLElement& e);
00084 
00085 #ifdef DEBUG
00086         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00087 #endif
00088 
00089 protected:
00090         UString str,
00091                           value,         // Value of the element
00092                           accessorName,  // Name  of the element (minus namespace name)
00093                           namespaceName; // Name  of the namespace (minus accessor name)
00094 
00095         UVector<UXMLAttribute*> attributeContainer; // Retrieve attributes using attribute name
00096 
00097 private:
00098         UXMLElement(const UXMLElement&)            {}
00099         UXMLElement& operator=(const UXMLElement&) { return *this; }
00100 };
